@template default-docs

h1. How to configure Ubuntu to connect to OpenVPN

*# Open Terminal @LF In Unity @LF Dash \-> Search for Terminal @LF In Gnome @LF Application menu \-> Accessories \-> Terminal @LF or @LF Keyboard Shortcut: `Ctrl + Alt + T`
*# Run the following command `apt-get install network-manager-openvpn`
*# Right-click on the network icon on the system tray
*# Choose: "Edit Connections"
*# Click Add @LF !image.png!
*# Choose Connection Type : openvpn @LF !image1.png!
*# The following window will open: @LF !image2.png!
*## Enter the connection name as example "VPN connection"
*## Enter the Gateway
*## Under the Authentication \-> Type \-> choose Passowrd @LF !image3.png!
*## Download our CA certificate
*## Enter the username and the passowrd
*## Import the CA certificate you just downloaded
*# Click "Advanced" the following window will open: @LF !image4.png!
*## Set "Use Custom gateway port " to 999
*## Mark "Use a TCP connection"
*## Click "OK" and then Save
*# Right-click on the network icon on the system tray
*# Choose " VPN Connection then choose the new connection
